summary: This is an FBI 302 interview report of a Bureau of Prisons Unit Manager at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York, conducted on August 12, 2019. The employee provides detailed information about MCC operations, protocols, and his interactions with Jeffrey Epstein in the days leading up to Epstein's death on August 10, 2019. The report covers the employee's assistance with Epstein's phone call on August 9, the discovery of Epstein's death, and observations about potential security lapses.

persons.name: Elisabeth Wheeler
persons.context: FBI Special Agent who interviewed the BOP Unit Manager along with SA Fusco and AUSA Roos.

persons.name: David Fusco
persons.role: Office of the Inspector General Special Agent
persons.context: OIG SA who provided the warnings form and participated in the interview of the BOP Unit Manager.

persons.name: Nicolas Roos
persons.context: AUSA for the Southern District of New York who participated in the interview and provided documentation for review.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The inmate found deceased in his cell at MCC on August 10, 2019. The interview details his housing, suicide attempt in July, and interactions with staff.

persons.name: Lieutenant Jean
persons.context: Was the Activities Lieutenant on August 9, 2019. Conducted welfare checks on COs Thomas and Noel after Epstein's death.

persons.name: Lieutenant Cannata
persons.context: Was the Operations Lieutenant on August 9, 2019, filling in for another lieutenant on leave.

persons.name: Captain Darden
persons.context: Captain to whom the lieutenants report; always works the day watch.

persons.name: Michael Davis
persons.context: SHU CO who was guarding Epstein during his phone call on August 9. Reported Epstein gave him a thumbs-up during the 10:00 p.m. stand-up count.

persons.name: T. Noel
persons.context: SHU CO who was guarding Epstein during his phone call on August 9. Was in a daze after Epstein's death and was subject to a welfare check on August 12.

persons.name: J. Masullo
persons.context: Staff member from 'Internal' who was present guarding Epstein during his phone call on August 9.

persons.name: Skipper-Scott
persons.context: AW who called the interviewee to inform him of Epstein's suicide attempt. Assigned him to guard Epstein's body at the hospital.

persons.name: D. McBaine
persons.context: CMC responsible for taking Epstein's fingerprints; accompanied the interviewee to the hospital where Epstein's body was held.

persons.name: Dupree
persons.context: CO who was with Epstein's body at the hospital and helped create a decoy to thwart the media during body transport.

persons.name: Adams
persons.context: CO who was with Epstein's body at the hospital and helped create a decoy. Also identified as R. Adams, who would have known Epstein was without a cellmate.

persons.name: Edge
persons.context: AW, new to MCC, to whom the interviewee provided his memo and timeline of events after Epstein's death.

persons.name: Glen McDonald
persons.context: Captain who emailed the interviewee, but the interviewee responded that he couldn't talk about the situation.

persons.name: Thomas
persons.context: CO who did not report to work on August 12, 2019, and was subject to a welfare check conducted by Lt. Jean.

persons.name: R. Silvia
persons.context: CO who, based on assignment rosters, would have been in a position to know Epstein was without a cellmate.

persons.name: R. Chimming
persons.context: CO who, based on assignment rosters, would have been in a position to know Epstein was without a cellmate.

persons.name: N. Dejesus
persons.context: CO who, based on assignment rosters, would have been in a position to know Epstein was without a cellmate.

connections.description: CO Davis was guarding Epstein during his phone call on August 9. Epstein gave Davis a thumbs-up during the 10:00 p.m. stand-up count.
CO Noel was guarding Epstein during his phone call on August 9 and was on watch during the time of Epstein's death.
Associate Warden Skipper-Scott called the interviewee about Epstein's suicide and assigned him to guard the body. The interviewee had her phone number.
Lt. Jean conducted a welfare check on CO Noel after he did not report to work on August 12, 2019.
Lt. Jean conducted a welfare check on CO Thomas after he did not report to work on August 12, 2019.
COs Dupree and Adams were together guarding Epstein's body at the hospital and collaborated to create a decoy for the media.

events.title: Epstein's Previous Suicide Attempt
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein attempted to commit suicide while housed in the SHU. A doctor informed staff verbally that Epstein must always have a cellmate as a result.

events.title: Epstein's Phone Call
events.description: The interviewee assisted Jeffrey Epstein in making a 15-minute phone call from the shower area on G tier. Epstein called a (347) number and spoke to a male.

events.title: Epstein Found Deceased
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found deceased in his cell at MCC, slumped over with a noose around his neck. He was found during the morning watch.

events.title: Body Transport and Media Deception
events.description: OCME personnel transported Epstein's body. COs Dupree and Adams created a decoy with boxes and sheets to mislead the press, allowing the body to leave unnoticed in a black vehicle.

events.title: Interview of BOP Unit Manager
events.description: FBI SA Elisabeth Wheeler, OIG SA David Fusco, and AUSA Nicolas Roos interviewed a BOP Unit Manager regarding Epstein's death and MCC procedures.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC), 150 Park Row, New York, New York
FBI-New York offices, 290 Broadway, New York, New York
MCC hospital on Park Row (separate from main building)
keyFacts: The interviewee, a BOP Unit Manager, assisted Jeffrey Epstein with a phone call on the evening of August 9, 2019, approximately 15 hours before Epstein was found dead.
Epstein had previously attempted suicide in July 2019, leading to a verbal order that he must always have a cellmate, but this was not documented in writing or visually posted.
On the night of his death, Epstein's cellmate had not returned from court, leaving him alone, a fact several assigned COs would have known but the interviewee was unaware of.
The MCC's video surveillance system was not functioning properly at the time of Epstein's death, though staff operated under the assumption it was working.
After Epstein's death, staff created a decoy body to mislead the press during the transport of Epstein's actual body by the Office of Chief Medical Examiner.
